text: When I was on the continent last week I found my EE phone still worked, but my laptop didn’t. I didn’t have time to packet inspect, but I suspect my phone was effectively VPN’ing back to the U.K. for data ingress/egress because EE had set it up that way. Otherwise, yeah, VPN is one way.

text: I run my prod stuff in London or Ireland, not my laptop, so not an issue.

elements.text: I run my prod stuff in London or Ireland, not my laptop, so not an issue.

text: Sorry, my VPM question was in response to <@USWDY5P7G>'s suggestion that I turn my Linux cloud server into a personal VPN server.

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

elements.text: Sorry, my VPM question was in response to
's suggestion that I turn my Linux cloud server into a personal VPN server.

text:
You can install a Dockerizer OpenVPN server on your Linux machine:
<https://dockovpn.io>

elements.text: You can install a Dockerizer OpenVPN server on your Linux machine:

text: Well, wait a second. I would not run vpn software on the same instance as where my prod strategies are. Also, depending on how that server is set up (EC2? Fargate?), you might be trying to run a container inside a container. That’s potentially not great for a bunch of reasons.

elements.text: Well, wait a second. I would not run vpn software on the same instance as where my prod strategies are. Also, depending on how that server is set up (EC2? Fargate?), you might be trying to run a container inside a container.
That’s
potentially not great for a bunch of reasons.

text: To be honest unless you have an explicit reason to not use something like NordVPN, and you can explain and quantify the impact of running it on your prod strategy instance you should probably just buy some vpn software or just enjoy your holiday and leave things running while you’re away. If you’re worried, switch things off for a week or two.

text: In any case, I had a similar experience abroad like Paul: when connecting to Betfair using my Three or Vodafone SIMs, it works fine because likely all traffic goes through the UK APN of said providers
